definition: to stop following a vegetarian diet/to break a fast

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
old variant of 齋|斋[zhai1]
to fast or abstain from meat, wine etc/vegetarian diet/study room/building/to give alms (to a monk)
Eid al-Fitr or Feast of Breaking the Fast, celebrated on the last day of Ramadan
see 開齋節|开斋节[Kai1 zhai1 jie2]

sentences.english: I would not consider such a family, as you described, a deserving of Zakat Al-Fitr or of Zakat Al-Mal.
sentences.chinese: 我不认为你所说的这样的家庭应当开斋捐或者天课。

sentences.english: Eid-al-Fitr marks the end of Muslim fasting month of Ramadan.
sentences.chinese: 开斋节标示著穆斯林斋戒月的结束。

sentences.english: Change from well-known after the Eid al-Fitr.
sentences.chinese: 从这以后开斋节变的很有名了。

sentences.english: There was a Festival of the Fast-Breaking Ceremony in the mosque today.
sentences.chinese: 今天在清真寺举行了开斋节庆典。

sentences.english: Muslims attend the Eid-al-Fitr prayers at the Jama Masjid (mosque) in the old quarters of Delhi October 14, 2007 .
sentences.chinese: 穆斯林在印度德里的一间清真寺参与开斋节祈祷。

sentences.english: But, I will expected a lot of vehicles went there.
sentences.chinese: 但，我会预料开斋节会有很多人上云顶。

sentences.english: White House iftars have been held annually for the past 10 years.
sentences.chinese: 在过去10年中，白宫每年都举办开斋晚宴。

sentences.english: The first day of Hari Raya, my father and again he planned to go Genting Highland.
sentences.chinese: 开斋节的第一天，我老爸再一次计划到云顶高原游玩。

sentences.english: For Allah, I determine to perform two rakaats of the Eid-ul-Fitr Prayer following the Imam.
sentences.chinese: 我诚意为主，跟从领导者，进行两拜开斋节拜。

sentences.english: That few days of raya I work for my dad in his clinic.
sentences.chinese: 开斋节的那几天都在我爸的诊疗所帮忙。

sentences.english: Today is the first day of Hari Raya Puasa .
sentences.chinese: 今天是回教开斋节的第一天。

sentences.english: "The Eid here is totally different from the Islamic world, " noted Auf.
sentences.chinese: 这里的开斋节与伊斯兰世界完全不同。

sentences.english: Ramadan is a month of blessings and prayers.
sentences.chinese: 开斋月是被祝福和保佑的一个月。

definition: to pray
Passover (Jewish holiday)
food given to Buddhist monks as alms
Buddha's Birthday (8th day of the 4th Lunar month)
pilaf (rice dish popular in many parts of the world, including Xinjiang)/pilau
Islam
food
(of a family) to come together at lunar New Year's Eve/family reunion at New Year's
Ascension Day (Christian festival forty days after Easter)
evening
evening meal/dinner/supper/CL:份[fen4],頓|顿[dun4],次[ci4],餐[can1]
steamed bun
Sabbath
Ghosts' festival on 15th day of 7th moon
great meal/banquet
Corpus Christi (Catholic festival on second Thursday after Whit Sunday)
